En la actualidad ha sabido aprovechar sus recursos y  la motivación más grande que tiene es poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo y brindarle un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía como¨ jarrones, casas de barro, floreros, adornos de cocina, alcancillas, cisne de barro, adornos de jardín, maceteros.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mabel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva ofrecen a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mabel is 27 years old and is a single mother with a young son. She originally comes from La Paz Centro, which is situated in the west of the country and is known for its typical food which is "quesillo" [tortilla with cream cheese filling].

Mabel has shown she is responsible and has a desire to get on in life. Unfortunately due to a lack of regular employment she had been unable to find work until she decided to start her business because she needed an income to spend on her son. Now she has learnt how to make good use of her resources and her biggest motivation is to be able to bring her little son up well and give him a better future. Thanks to her hard work and desire to get on in life she has a business selling crafts such as vases, clay houses, kitchen decorations, piggy banks, clay swans, garden ornaments and plant pots. She spends 10 hours a day working to sell her products. 

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital and stock her business buying and selling crafts, so that in the not-too-distant future she will be able to make more income. 

Mabel thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they offer to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to have working capital and stock her business buying and selling crafts such as: vases, clay houses, kitchen decorations, piggy banks, clay swans, garden ornaments and plant pots.

loans.name: Brigida Sobeida

texts.es: Brigida Sobeida mayor de edad casada con tres hijas menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y con muchos deseos de supercion personal. es una microempresaria quien es propietaria y administradora de una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación donde comercializa todo tipo productos del consumidor como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, leche, embutidos, productos perecederos,productos congelados entre otros, cuenta con el salario que recibe de dar clases en medio tiempo, aprovechando para comercializar mercadería en general por encargos siendo sus clientes fijos mayormente asalariados y otros, Brigida inicia su su negocio con capital propios viendo la necesidad de poder aportar un poco mas en su hogar, uno de sus anhelos es poder construir un cuarto de habitación para proveerle privacidad a sus hijas, y crecer en su negocio, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en la pulperia en la compra de: productos básicos, queso, pollo carnes, embutidos entre otros.
texts.en:
Brigida Sobeida is married and has three adult children.  She is from the town of Chinandega, located in the west of the country, and she is known as a very enterprising, responsible woman with many desires to get ahead.  She is a small businesswoman who owns a store, where she sells all sorts of products, such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, snacks, soft drinks, milk, sausages, perishable products, frozen products, and other things.  She also teaches part time and takes orders for products from her steady salaried customers and others.

Brigida started her business with her own capital, having seen the need to bring in a little more income.  One of her greatest desires is to build a room onto her home so she can provide more privacy to her daughters, and also to grow the business over time.  She will use the money from this loan to buy basic products such as cheese, chicken, meats, sausages, and other things for her store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Warmicuna Llanqanchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLAQANCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bibiana ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende arroz,azúcar,leche y galletas, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “WARMICUNA LLAQANCHIS” communal bank, situated in the district of Anta, which belongs to Anta province and Cusco department.

Bibiana, who is a member, is 57 years old, is single and has 3 children. She works in her business selling and rearing animals and also has a grocery shop where she sells rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. Bibiana breeds the chickens and guinea pigs, grows them on then fattens them and sells them at the various markets. Thanks to her small business she is able to bring up her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the chickens and guinea pigs.

Bibiana is asking for the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and feed for them. The other members have businesses selling beauty products, selling crafts, a grocery shop and selling animals.

Bibiana is grateful to those who are helping her achieve her dream in this way and promises to pay her instalments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Tynar

texts.ru: Тынар 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Тынар - высшее образование, она и ее супруг работают преподавателями в местной школе, пользуются большим уважением в селе, так как супруги очень хорошие люди и профессиональные учителя. С них берут пример, так как они не только работают в школе, но и занимаются параллельно животноводством, а также обрабатывают 3,0 ГА земельной доли. Инициатором всего этого выступает Тынар, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тынар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 4 теленка, 20 овец, 1 лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,0 ГА, на котором выращивает тыкву, картофель и многолетнюю траву. Также в зимний период реализует молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Тынар входит в группу "Диана", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Тынар является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тынар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома для старшего сына.
texts.en:
Tynar is 48 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Tynar has a higher education. She and her husband work as teachers at a local school and are well-respected in their village, as they both are good people and professional educators. They are good role models, as they not only work in a school, but also simultaneously practice animal breeding and cultivate a 3.0 hectare plot of land. 

Tynar was the initiator of all this, starting this business business 20 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tynar's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 4 calves, 20 sheep and 1 horse on her farm, as well as a 3.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows pumpkins, potatoes and perennial grasses. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). Tynar is in the agricultural group "Diana." There are two other members in this group; Tynar is the second member of the group. 

For the purpose of further developing her business, Tynar turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy heifers to increase the size of her herd. Tynar plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a house for her eldest son.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 20 years old. He lives in a village in Palestine west of Ramallah with his family. Mohammad works in the public sector. His salary is around $400 per month. He asked Ryada for this loan to repair his house. He wants to repair his ceiling, electricity and the windows because Mohammad wants to get married soon. This will give him step forward to get the house ready faster. 

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Joan Nauel

texts.es:
Joan Nauel es un joven estudiante de Publicidad, el esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es JOAN y tengo 18 años. Nací, crecí en San Juan de la Maguana, en la Republica Dominicana. Tengo 5 hermanos; mi madre es estilista y mi papa actualmente no trabaja por problemas de salud, pero me han inculcado valores que me han ayudado a desarrollarme como persona y como profesional.


Quiero estudiar en la Universidad APEC en Santo Domingo, capital de la Republica Dominicana y estudiare Publicidad, ya que es la carrera que me gusta, me apasiona y en la que más me siento identificado, puesto que crecí conociendo el mundo de la comunicación y el medio artístico y fui desarrollando esa pasión por el arte.


Necesito el préstamo para poder costear mis estudios y gastos durante el mismo, ya que no cuento con trabajo y el salario de mis padres no son suficientes para costear mis estudios. La verdad no se que haría si no recibiera el préstamo porque siempre he querido estudiar en esa universidad. Este préstamo me ayudara a estudiar la carrera que me apasiona.
\

Mi meta académica es graduarme y ser reconocido como el mejor publicista de mi país. Pretendo también ayudar a mi familia económicamente y después de terminar la carrera, me gustaría trabajar en mi área; en una agencia publicitaria o en el área de comunicación.
texts.en:
Joan Nauel is a young publicity student who is requesting a loan to pay for his studies. This is his story:

My name is Joan and I am 18 years old. I was born and raised in San Juan de la Maguana in the Dominican Republic. I have five siblings; my mother is a stylist and my father is not working at the moment due to health problems, but they have instilled values in me that have helped me to develop on a personal and professional level.

I want to  study at the APEC University in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic, and study Publicity, as this is the course that appeals to me and which I am passionate about. I identify most with this course because I grew up in a world of communication and show business, which further developed my passion for the arts.


I need this loan to fund my studies and expenses during the course since I no longer work and my parents' salary is not enough to fund my studies. The truth is that I don't know what I will do if I don't get this loan because I have always wanted to study at that university and this loan would help me to study the course that I am passionate about.

My academic goal is to graduate and be recognised as the best publicist in my country. I would also like to help my family financially and after finishing my course I would like to work in my area as a publicity agent or in the field of communication.

loans.use: to pay for uni fees and books for his studies in Publicity

loans.name: Rita Alexandra

texts.es:
Rita Alexandra es una joven estudiante de Enfermeria, ella esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Rita, vivo en Monte Bonito, Cienfuegos, Rep. Dom. Vivo con mi madre, hermana, tía y prima. Soy soltera y no tengo hijos.
Soy una joven que requiere de su apoyo para poder obtener nuevos conocimientos que me permitan mi desarrollo personal y laboral; desarrollar al máximo mis potencialidades y obtener un titulo universitario.
Tengo escaso recursos, mis padres no me pueden sustentar mis estudios ya que mi padre no gana lo suficiente.
Quiero seguir cursando mis estudios en Lic. Enfermería en la Universidad Tecnológica de Santiago (UTESA), elegí esta carrera porque puedo realizarme y proyectarme como una profesional ya que es mi vocación, dándoles a los usuarios la dedicación que necesitan. Empecé esta carrera en enero 2013, curse mi primer cuatrimestre y no pude seguir por falta de recursos.
 Este préstamo es muy necesario porque me ayudará a seguir cursando mis estudios; de manera tal  que  podría realizarme profesionalmente y Seré  útil a mi familia y  la sociedad, se que este préstamo cambiaria mi vida ya que  obtendré una mano amiga en la que podré confiar y lograr mis objetivos.
Mis metas y sueños son, terminar mis estudios universitarios, maestría etc. Ayudar  mi familia, brindar mi mayor desempeño profesional.
texts.en:
Rita Alexandra is a young nursing student. She is asking for a loan to be able to pay for her studies, this is her story:

My name is Rita, I live in Monte Bonito, Cienfuegos, in the Dominican Republic. I live with my mother, sister, aunt and cousin. I am not married and have no children. I am a young woman who needs your support to be able to learn new things which will contribute to my personal and professional development; and develop fully my potential and obtain a degree. I do not have a lot of money, and my parents cannot fund my studies as my father does not earn enough. I want to continue my studies for a nursing degree at the Technological University of Santiago (UTESO). I chose this course because I can become and present myself as a professional, since it is my vocation, giving patients the dedication they need. I started this course in January 2013, I was in my first semester, and I could not afford to continue studying.

This loan is much needed because it will help me continue my studies so that I will become a professional, and I will be useful to my family and society. I know that this loan will change my life as I will obtain a lifeline that I can trust and so achieve my goals. My aims and dreams are to finish my studies at university, my masters etc, help my family and do my job as best I can.

loans.use: to pay for registration, transport and books for her nursing course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kelvin Ramon

texts.es:
Kelvin Ramón es un joven estudiante de Medicina, el esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia Mi nombre es Kelvin y tengo 21 años de edad. Actualmente resido en la ciudad de Santo Domingo en casa de una amiga de la familia, nací en la provincia de Barahona, sur de la Rep. Dominicana, emigrando de mi provincia en busca de cumplir el sueño que he deseado desde pequeño, ser doctor. Mi familia no es numerosa, ya que solo tengo 1 hermano.
Actualmente me encuentro cursando el 2do cuatrimestre de Medicina en la Universidad Tecnológica de Santiago (UTESA). Necesito el préstamo de FUNDAPEC Kiva, porque esta sería una gran ayuda para continuar mis estudios.
De recibir el préstamo Wao! Esta sería la oportunidad más grande en mi vida, ya que no tendré obstáculos  para pagar la universidad y así pudiera continuar estudiando la carrera que tanto me gusta, y en un futuro ser lo que siempre he anhelado, Dr. en medicina en el área de Pediatría, ya que me encantan los niños.
Luego de terminar mi carrera, mi objetivo principal es dar lo mejor de mi día a día, de todo lo que aprendí en mi trayecto de enseñanza a cada ser humano que me toque examinar, haciéndolo con paciencia, entrega, dedicación y sobre todo muchísimo amor, para aliviar el dolor de quienes acudan a mí a buscar su mejoría.

Kelvin
texts.en:
Kelvin Ramón is a young medicine student and is applying for a loan in order to pay for his studies.  

This is Kelvin's story:

"My name is Kelvin and I am 21 years old.  I currently live in the city of Santo Domingo, in the house of a friend of the family.  I was born in the Barahona province in the south of the Dominican Republic.  I left my home province in the hope of achieving my lifelong dream of becoming a doctor.  My family is not very big - I have only one brother.

"I am currently in second semester, studying medicine at the Universidad Tecnológica de Santiago (UTESA).  I need this loan from FUNDAPEC and Kiva because it would be a great help for me to continue my studies.

"Receiving this loan would be amazing! This would be the biggest opportunity I have had in my life. I would have no obstacles to overcome to pay university fees and so I could continue studying the degree that I like so much.  Then, in the future, I can become what I have always wanted to be - a paediatrics doctor, as I love children.

"After finishing my degree, my objective is to do my best every day - with everything I learn in my studies I want to do the best for everyone I have to treat.  I will work with patience, dedication and, above all, with lots of love, so that I can relieve the pain of those who come to me in order to get better."

Kelvin

loans.use: to buy university fees for his degree in medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Cecilia Marleny

texts.es:
Cecilia Marleny es una joven estudiante de Medicina, ella esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Cecilia, tengo 19 años de edad. Nací en La vega pero vivo en Santo Domingo, soy soltera, no tengo hijos y soy la mayor de tres hermanos, entre ellos una hermana, con edades de 14, 15 y 17 años.
A la edad de 15 años, mis padres se divorciaron, quedando mi madre con todos los gastos y necesidades del hogar. Mi padre vive de la renta y otros negocios; mi madre cuida niños y tiene una sala de tarea a su cargo.
Estudio en UCATECI en la carrera de medicina. Me interesa esta carrera porque hay que poner en práctica diversos valores como la humildad, solidaridad, responsabilidad, entre otras. Además, es una carrera de mucha dedicación y con el que se le puede expresar amor al prójimo.
Este préstamo es de suma importancia para cubrir las necesidades de la Universidad, y de no recibirlo, tendré que dejar la carrera porque no cuento los recursos para costearla, es muy costosa. De modo que si me lo aprueban, me cambiaría la vida totalmente ya que me dará más fuerzas para continuar con la misma. Desde niña he soñado con ser doctora.
Una de mis metas es poder desarrollarme como una profesional exitosa, después hacer mi especialidad en pediatría, de este modo ejercerla con todas las herramientas que me permitan realizar un excelente trabajo, y así poner mi ciudad y mi país en alto.
texts.en:
Cecilia Marleny is a young woman studying medicine. She is requesting a loan to pay for her studies. This is her story:

My name is Cecilia, I am nineteen years old. I was born in La Vega, but I live in Santo Domingo. I am single and do not have kids. I am the oldest at home. I have a sister and two brothers, aged 14, 15 and 17. 

When I was fifteen my parents got divorced and my mother had to cover all the expenses at home. My father receives an income and has other businesses; my mother babysits and administers a workshop.

I am studying medicine at UCATECI. I am interested in this profession because it demands from people to be humble, responsible and to care about others, among other values. Besides, it requires a lot of dedication and gives you the opportunity to show you love your neighbors.

This loan is of great importance in order to cover my needs at the university. In case I do not get it, I would have to interrupt my studies because I do not have the resources to continue since it costs a lot to do so. This is to say that it would totally change my life to get it and I would have the strengths I need to pursue my degree. Ever since I was a girl I have dreamt of becoming a doctor.

One of my goals is to be able to become a successful professional, specialized in Pediatrics. Once I have all the tools, I will be able to perform an excellent job and honor my city and my country.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in Medicine.

loans.name: Erick Francisco

texts.es: Erick de 22 años de edad habita junto a su grupo familiar y de él depende gran parte de la economía del hogar. Erick trabaja como empleado en una institución cercana a su localidad y de esa forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su vivienda es muy humilde pero propia y está construida a base de lodo y bambú (Bahareque) lo cual la hace muy sensible a la humedad y a la crianza de insectos. Su deseo es mejorar esa situación por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento para repellar las paredes de la vivienda para protegerlas de las plagas y las humedades causadas por las lluvias.
texts.en: Erick is 22 years old and lives with his family. They depend on him greatly for a large part of the household income. Erick is employed by an institute near to his neighborhood and this is how he provides for his family. His home is very humble but it is their own. It is constructed from mud and bamboo, which makes it very susceptible to the humidity and insects. His wish is to improve this situation, which is why he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing sand and cement to plaster the walls of his home to protect his family from infestations and humidity caused by the rain.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama MUJERES VALIENTES están en el 1er. ciclo con quince integrantes, al adquirir esta oportunidad se les facilita herramientas fundamentales para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
Una de las integrantes la señora Teodora, quien se dedica a la compra y faena de animales como chancho y gallinas caceras, los vende desde su casa y una vez a la semana ofrece en una feria. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para los animales que ella cuida para después poder venderlos o faenarlos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Valientes" group is on its first loan cycle and has 15 members.  With this loan, they will be able to buy the basic tools that they need to progress with their businesses.

One member of the group is Teodora, who makes a living buying and raising animals, such as pigs and hens.  Teodora sells her products from her house and, once a week, also sells them at a market.  Teodora is applying for this loan in order to buy feed for the animals, so that she can later sell or slaughter them.  She is grateful for this opportunity as it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Lucia es soltera ,tiene 2 hijos y tiene 33 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,pefumes,entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo sus productos a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como colonias para damas.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio  de venta de artesanía, distribución de pescados, manualidades, brindado el servicio de taxi, venta de ropa y trabajadores de empresas privadas.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the "SENOR DE LOS MILAGROS" communal bank, which is in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.  The member concerned is Lucia, who is 33 and the mother of 2 children.  Alongside her daily tasks, she runs a business selling beauty products such as creams, eau de cologne and perfume amongst other things.  She has been involved in this business for some time now and it is going well as a result of the effort which she puts into her business each day.  She works independently, selling her products to her customers who request them - friends, relatives and others.  Lucia is a responsible person, which enables her to provide for her family.  She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise such as women's eau de cologne.  The other members of the group work in handicraft sales, fish distribution, crafts, running a taxi service, clothing sales or are employed in private companies.  Lucia is grateful to those whose involvement is helping her achieve her dream and guarantees that she will make her repayments within the agreed period.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as women's eau de cologne.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is 21 years old. She lives in Nablus at Balata Camp. Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950, adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank. She lives there with her husband and her three children. She sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many others in her grocery store. Nawal opened it three years ago.

Nawal is requesting a loan of $2,000 to expand her business and make display boxes so she can increase her stock. All the neighbors prefer to buy from her because of her good treatment and good staff.

Nawal is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand her business and make display boxes.

loans.name: Union Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia Luque ella es soltera y tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos; ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y lencería, la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos,medias entre otras ropas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD” communal bank, situated in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department.

Sonia Luque, who is a member, is 45 years old, is single and has 3 children. She works in her business selling clothing and lingerie. She sells jumpers, trousers, polo shirts, tights and other clothing. She works from 8am until 7pm taking her clothes to different places such as institutions or to her friends. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the clothing.

Sonia Luque is asking for the loan to buy jumpers, tights, polo shirts, trousers and jackets. The other members have businesses selling beauty products, selling crafts, a grocery shop and selling animals.

Sonia Luque is grateful to those who are helping her achieve her dream in this way and promises to pay her instalments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy jumpers, tights, polo shirts, trousers and jackets.

loans.name: Jymy Jose

texts.es: Jymy es originario de la ciudad de Granada, casado y sin hijos a cargo. De 26 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de accesorios y reparación de celulares. Inicio en este negocio hace pocos años, como trabajador en reparación de celulares. Con el paso del tiempo se fue independizando. Actualmente cuenta son su propio negocio, el cual ofrece hasta accesorios para celulares. Su meta próxima es mejorar sus negocios ofreciendo más accesorios para la venta. Solicita el crédito para comprar: auriculares, porta celulares, protectores de celulares, memoria micro entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad de productos a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que crecerá su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir extiendo su local.
texts.en:
Jymy comes from the city of Granada and is married with no children under his responsibility. He is 26 years old and works as a trader, selling accessories and repairing mobile phones. He started out in this business a few years ago, working in mobile phone repairs. Over time he set himself up independently and now has his own business, which also offers accessories for mobile phones. His next goal is to improve his business by offering more accessories for sale.

Jymy is asking for the loan to buy earphones, mobile phone cases and protectors, memory chips and other items, with the aim of offering a greater variety of products to his customers. He thinks the loan will be a great help to him, since he will be able to grow his business and generate better profits. His plan for the future is to carry on extending his stall.

loans.use: to buy earphones, mobile phone cases and protectors, memory chips and other items.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad es madre soltera y reside en casa propia junto a sus padres y su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad. Desde hace dos años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, dicho negocio lo tiene en su hogar de habitación y es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. María habita en condiciones muy humildes las cuales poco a poco va mejorando. Desea construir la cocina ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para preparar los alimentos y proteger sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para dar inicio lo antes posible a la construcción de la cocina que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her parents and her little daughter who is 11. For two years now she has worked making and selling bread from her home, and this is how she provides for her family. María lives in very humble conditions which are slowly getting better. She wants to construct a kitchen as she does not have an adequate space to prepare food and protect her few belongings.

She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to start off construction as soon as possible on the kitchen she needs so much.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Volida

texts.ru:
Волида родилась в 1960 году в семье простого рабочего. Она училась в средней школе отлично. После окончания средней школы она вышла замуж  таким образом не получила высшее образование. Она всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. 
Ее дочь учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете Коммерции. Она студентка 1 курса. Волида должна оплатить за учебу своей дочери, но, ни Волида, ни ее муж не имеют денег для оплаты учебы дочери. Ее муж сварщик. Волида запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Volida was born in 1960 into a blue-collar family. She did very well in secondary school. After graduating from secondary school, she got married which is why she did not get a higher education. She always dreamed that her children would get a higher education. Her daughter is studying at Tajik State Commercial University. She is a first-year student. Volida needs to pay for her daughter's education, but neither Volida nor her husband are able to pay for their daughter's tuition. Her husband is a welder. Volida is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to pay for her daughter's university tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s university tuition.

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sumac Puririsun 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “SUMAC PURIRISUN” communal bank, situated in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department.

Luz Marina, who is a member, is 43 years old, is single and has 2 children. She works in her business selling and rearing animals. She breeds the chickens and guinea pigs, grows them on then fattens them and sells them at the various markets. Thanks to her small business she is able to bring up her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the chickens and guinea pigs.

Luz Marina is asking for the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and feed for them. 

The other members have businesses selling beauty products, selling crafts, a grocery shop and selling animals.
Luz Marina is grateful to those who are helping her achieve her dream in this way and promises to pay her instalments in the agreed timeframe.

The person with the covered face does not belong to the Sumac Puririsun communal bank.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она пережила много трудности с своей жизни. С юных лет она трудилась упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и помочь своим родителям. Она научилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Малохат после замужества продолжила свою деятельность. В течение многих лет она введет свой бизнес успешно. Малохат данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке. Она хочет купить скот и начать дополнительный бизнес скотоводством и таким образом, зарабатывать больше денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать бизнес. Скот она будет откармливать у себя дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Malohat is a kind and cheerful woman. She has survived many difficulties in her life. From a young age, she worked hard to earn money and help her parents. She studied under a seamstress and learned how to sew women's clothing. After she got married, she resumed her business. Over the course of many years, she has managed her business successfully. Currently, Malohat needs financial support. She wants to buy cattle and start an additional business breeding cattle and, as a result, earn more money. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy cattle in order to organize her business. She will fatten up the cattle at her own house. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to start her new business.

loans.name: Kema

texts.en:
Kema is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. 

Kema has requested a loan to to buy a weed-sprayer, a spade, chemicals, taro roots, a wheelbarrow and bush knives. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Kema hopes to save for unexpected emergencies and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a weed-sprayer, a spade, chemicals, taro roots, a wheelbarrow and bush knives.

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
Aura de 35 años de edad, casada sin hijos es originaria de  Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del  país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Ella realizo sus estudio, pero por herencia de sus padres continuo el negocio como es tapizar cajas fúnebres. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación, ella dedica  a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con materiales de tapicería como pega clavos, forros, telas, cuero, barniz. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.

Aura agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Aura is 35 years old. She is married with no children. She is originally from Managua, which is located in the centre of the country. She is hard-working, responsible, with the will for personal development. She is studying, but with the inheritance of her parents she has continued the business of upholstering coffins. This activity is carried out in their home, and Aura works about 10 hours a day offering her services.

The objective of the loan is to invest working capital and stock her business with upholstery materials such as glue, nails, lining, fabrics, leather and varnish. This is so that in the near future she can increase her income. Aura is grateful for the help offered by Kiva lenders to people with little money and from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they have the means for a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy materials for upholstering coffins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his broken motorcycle

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 27 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maribel has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 30 years old and married with two children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lornalyn

texts.en:
Lornalyn is 50 years old and married with one kid.

Lornalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Lornalyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Lornalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Kirisimasi

texts.en:
Kirisimasi is a 21-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro to earn a living. 

Kirisimasi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, taro roots, a weed-sprayer, bush knives, and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD for one month. Kirisimasi will spend her profits to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, taro roots, a weedsprayer, bush knives, and a spade

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lynette works hard to support her family. She makes and sells coconut pies in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Lynette is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lynette has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dressmaking. 

Criselda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 29 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko), noodles, water, cigarettes, salt, sugar, coffee, books and rice. 

She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko), noodles, water, cigarettes, salt, sugar, coffee, books and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood to sell, e.g. shrimps, fish and crabs.

loans.name: Jose Gudiel

texts.es:
José, está solicitando crédito porque necesita para comprar 6 sacos de abono y pagara mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha, con esto el podrá condicionar la tierra para tener una mejor cosecha. 
Con la inversión anterior el sus ventas aumentaron, sus ingresos han tenido un crecimiento muy importante pues con ellos ha cancelado deudas, ha apoyado en los gastos del hogar y a cubierto las necesidades educativas de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jose is requesting this loan to buy six sacks of fertilizer and to pay for the labor to harvest his crops. He says that with the fertilizer he will be able to condition the land in order to have a better harvest. He says that with his previous loan his sales increased and he saw an important increase in his income, with which he was able to pay off debts, pay for household expenses and pay for school supplies for his children.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer and to pay for the labor to harvest his crops.

loans.name: Sepoima

texts.en:
Sepoima is 36 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption items such as chicken legs, snacks, sweets, rice, flour, sugar, and much more. She has being doing this for five years.

Sepoima needs a loan to buy a bag of rice, a bag of flour, a freezer, a cooler, a box of chicken legs, and much more. She hopes to use her profits to expand her store and to pay for her children's school fees. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a bag of flour, a freezer, a cooler, a box of chicken legs, etc.

loans.name: Urmat

texts.ru: Урмату 26 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 1 сына, с ними проживает мать Урмата, которая помогает им по хозяйству и с воспитанием внука. У Урмата - среднее образование, Урмат по сезонно подрабатывает на стройках. А в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Урмат занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Урмата, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, 1 лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,50 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль, картофель и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). Урмат входит в группу "Диана", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Урмат является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Урмат обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Урмат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Urmat is 26, married, and is raising one son. His mother, who helps them around the house and taking care of their son, lives with them. Urmat is the family’s main  breadwinner; he raises livestock and farms. He started doing this five years ago, when he bought a cow for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to his hard work, his farm now has 1 dairy cow, 10 sheep, and 1 horse. He also has 1.5 hectares of land on which he grows beans, potatoes, and clover. Their monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). Urmat is joining the Diana group, which has two other members.  With the goal of further developing his business, Urmat has turned to the Bai-Tushum & Partners micro lending bank for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for increasing the size of his herd. He plans on investing the income earned with the loan onto further increasing his livestock herd, and plans on saving up money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Petesa

texts.en:
Petesa is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, yams, and taro, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

Petesa is requesting a loan from SPPD, which she will use to buy safety boots, chemicals, taro roots, bush knives, and to pay for labor. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Petesa hopes to support her family and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase safety boots, chemicals, taro roots, bush knives and to pay for labor

loans.name: Sauoleola

texts.en:
Sauoleola is 31 years old and has three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Sauoleola needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since October 2013. Sauoleola will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Faith Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Faith Joy works hard to support her family. She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Faith Joy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional computer units for her internet cafe.

Faith Joy has sustained her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units for her business

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita is 22 years old.  She is a hard working woman from a remote region of Bagnan in the small town Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband, Manu, and their two children.   Her husband, Manu, is 25 years old. They live in their own small kachha (made of straw and mud) house.

Both Sumita and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  Their children are below the school-going age.

Sumita's husband is a greengrocer by profession. That is the only source of income in the family.  He sells seasonal and fresh vegetables in the market.
But it is a competitive market; his earning is not enough to provide sustenance. 

So Sumita decided to give financial assistance to her husband and family by cultivating a rice crop in their land, and she applied for the loan. With this loan she wants to buy rice seeds and good quality fertilizers.  Rice is the staple food of West Bengal and has a great demand in the present market.  
 
Her dreams are to provide higher education for their children, to meet the expenses of their family and to develop their business so that they will be able to earn more profit.

She is thankful to BJS as well as to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating a rice paddy.

loans.name: Ahina

texts.en:
Ahina is a 32-year-old housewife.  She lives at Gadang in the small town of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaigur .  Her husband, Karam, 35 years old, is a cycle-van puller by profession. He drives a cycle-van to carry goods and people from one place to another. Both of them are illiterate and can sign their names.  Their only son works as a mason.  They live in their own kachha (mud and straw made) house.

Their earning is not sufficient to maintain their household expenses. So, Ahina and her husband decided to grow beans in their own land, to generate more income. Then Ahina came to know about BJS and took a loan to purchase a good quantity of fertilizers and seeds to cultivate beans.  There is a great demand for beans in the local market. She hopes this business will give them an opportunity to make more profit.

She hopes that the business will enable her to give financial assistance to her family and to make a pacca (brick-built) house of their own in the future.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seeds and fertilizers for cultivating beans.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima lives in a remote region of West Bengal.  She lives in the small town of Maynaguri in the district Jalpaigur.  She is 20 years old and a housewife. Her husband, Upen, 24 years old, is a cycle-van puller, who earns a livelihood by carrying people and goods  in his van. Anima received education up to class VIII ( Grade 8) and her husband received secondary education. They have only one son, who is below the school-going age. They live in a semi-pacca (walls made with brick and a straw roof) house.

Upen's income is not sufficient to bear all the household expenses of his family. So Anima decided to help her husband financially.  She has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cow and start a business of dairy products, such as milk, paneer, butter, etc, in the market.  There is a huge demand for these products in her locality and in the present market.

This loan will help Anima to start her business and earn profit, with which she will be able to meet the family's expenses and the educational expenses of her son. In the future she hopes to buy more cows with the profit she earns from the business. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start a dairy products business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family.  She sells firewood in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling fish.  

Emilia is requesting her fifth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks of firewood. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Francisca has been in this business for five years. Francisca earns more income from farming rice.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jenalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenalyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending. Jenalyn aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Leuo

texts.en:
Leuo is a 54-year-old divorced woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10 years.

Leuo has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Leuo hopes to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

Faavae needs a loan to purchase a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, boots and taro roots. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Faavae will use the profits from her sales to save for unexpected emergencies and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, boots and taro roots.

loans.name: Silaulelei

texts.en:
Silaulelei is a 57-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business of sewing clothes and selling them in her community. She has 10 years of experience with this business. 

Silaulelei has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, threads, oil and scissors. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, threads, oil and scissors.

loans.name: Faamafu

texts.en: Faamafu is a 73-year-old woman who is married with 12 children. She has a small business, raising and selling cows. She has 10 years experience with this business. Faamafu needs a loan to buy wires and more cows . She will use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. Faamafu joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy wires and more cows

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 52 years old and lives with her two sons in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. They live in a one-room apartment. Oyunchimeg has retired from work and gets state pension. Her elder son works as a sentry at state reserve center. Her younger son is an electrician at a power station. 

Oyunchimeg is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the on-board source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. This car will be used by her younger son who wants to provide taxi service to local people as an extra source of income during his day off.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Ma. Victoria. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy materials for making foam beds. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Ma. Victoria would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of foam and other materials needed in making foam beds. Having more items to sell will lead to better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Victoria hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of foam and other materials needed in making foam beds.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият заботливая мать 3 детей. Она разведена. Ее муж развелся с ней и живет в России. Она очень сильная женщина. После развода, не теряя времени и надежду, она начала свой бизнес. Она открыла кафе. Хосияту помогает ее невеста. Они приготавливают национальные блюда, и продает местным жителям. В основном во время обеда много народа посещают ее кафе. Хосият старается держать кафе чисто и привлечь больше клиентов вкусными национальными блюдами. Хосият планирует увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания для своего кафе. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hosiyat is the loving mother of three children. Her husband divorced her and now lives in Russia, but she is a very strong woman. After the divorce, she did not waste time or lose hope. Instead, she started her own business and opened a cafe. Her daughter helps her prepare Tajik specialties for the local residents. Many people come to her cafe for lunch. Hosiyat tries to keep the cafe clean and attract more customers with her delicious national dishes. She plans to increase her working capital and has requested a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy more food products for her cafe. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items and increase the working capital of her cafe

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 33, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Dindo, a mechanic, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia is a vendor. She sells fish, meat, and different vegetables. Her store is located in front of her house where it can be easily seen by buyers.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish, meat, and vegetables for her business. 

Lilia hopes to expand her business and have other stalls. She dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, meat, and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Sheena has been in this business for four years. Sheena earns additional income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish for her business.

Sheena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Mely works hard to support her family. She has a farming rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Mely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

Mely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosanna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase pesticides and other farm supplies.

Rosanna has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 50 years old and a married mother with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bella has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Bella requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell. Bella has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Bella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with four children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household items to sell like soap, coffee, milk, chips, etc. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional household items to sell like soap, coffee, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is 33 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom are in school.

Jenelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jenelie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Jenelie has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jenelie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 53 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elenita has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

Elenita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelda

texts.en:
Jocelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Jocelda earns additional income from selling firewood.

Jocelda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to sell. She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Jocelda dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Bangukana Group

texts.fr:
Méthode  fait partie du groupe  Bangukana  et  habite à Bubanza. Il  a 30 ans et est marie à Munezero. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant  de  2 ans.

Il fait le commerce cartes d’unités pour téléphones portables  depuis 7 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  150 cartes d’unités pour téléphones  portables  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  acheter  une parcelle  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Méthode is part of the group Bangukana and lives in Bubanza. He is 30 years old and married to Munezero. Together they have one child, who is 2 years old. 

Méthode has been selling mobile phone minutes for seven years.

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase 150 cards of phone minutes to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone minutes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Krezza

texts.en:
Krezza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Krezza earns additional income from food vending.

Krezza is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business. She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Krezza dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mylene works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from direct selling of natashia/avon products. 

Mylene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her fishing business. She has sustained her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. Mylene hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Jijie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jijie works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dressmaking. Jijie is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell for her fish vending business.

Jijie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Hector Arely

texts.es:
Héctor, se dispone a recolectar la cosecha por lo que solicita capital para pagara una maquina desgranadora y pagar mano de obra, con el préstamo anterior su negocio es más rentable, le genera más ingresos con los que pago sus cuotas y compro medicina para su hija.
Su economía mejoro y su familia está gozando de mejor alimentación, todos están muy saludables y siguen siendo unidos.
texts.en: Hector is ready to harvest his crops, and so he is requesting a loan to pay for a threshing machine and to pay for labor.  With his previous loan, his business was more profitable.  He was able to generate more income to make his loan payments and to buy medicine for his daughter.  His finances improved, and his family is enjoying better food.  The family members are all very healthy, and are united as they continue forward.

loans.use: to pay for a threshing machine and labor to harvest his crops

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Susan has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetables.

Susan is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 41 years old and widowed with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilou has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pelsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Pelsie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Pelsie is borrowing 50,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buying and selling of rice business.

Pelsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Mylyn has been in this business for 15 years. Mylyn earns additional income from buy and sell peanuts.

Mylyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle. 

Mylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Lyne works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food business in the Philippines. Lyne has been in this business for five years.

Lyne requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 8 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, es el pilar principal la de la familia, tiene la responsabilidad de generar los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Él tiene un taller mecánico que atiende de 6:00 a.m. hasta 4:00 p.m., su ventaja para atenderlo es que está ubicado en la misma propiedad de su casa.
Con la inversión comprara, bujías, espejos, baterías, llaves, aceite, lubricantes, así tendrá más repuestos para los vehículos que le llevan a reparación, con todo esto espera aumentara la satisfacción de sus clientes, sus ingresos aumentaran y podrá cancelar la deuda.
Su sueño es construir una galera para guardar vehículos y equipar su negocio con más herramientas para mejorar el servicio y tener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has 2 children aged 20 and 8.  He lives with his wife and their children.  Juan is the main pillar of the family; he has the responsibility of generating the income to cover their household needs.  He has a mechanics workshop where he works from 6am until 4pm.  It's easy for him to tend to the workshop, because it's located on the same property as his home.

With this investment, he will buy spark plugs, mirrors, batteries, wrenches, motor oil, and lubricants.  This way he will have more spare parts for the vehicles that come for repairs.  With this investment, he hopes to increase customer satisfaction with his business and increase his income so that he will be able to pay off his debt.

Juan's dreams are: to build a garage to store vehicles, to outfit his business with more tools to improve his service, and to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, mirrors, batteries, wrenches, motor oil, and lubricants

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a 34-year-old married woman from the small village of Bengkandi in the small town of Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband and her daughter. Both Kabita and her husband, Shyamal, are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. Her daughter reads in class VIII (Grade 8).
 
Kabita's husband runs a cycle shop. Prior to having his own business, her husband was engaged in a cycle shop where he learned repairing work.  Using that experience, he has opened his own shop where he sells bicycle parts (like chains, tires, brakes, valves, etc.) and repairs cycles.  But due to a competitive market, there are many other shops nearby, so it has become very difficult for them to run the business.

Kabita requested a loan from BJS to decorate their shop and to purchase modern spare parts to enhance their business. 

She dreams her daughter will lead a very successful life with a good education. She also hopes that she will be able to improve the lifestyle of her family.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cycle spare parts and other materials for her husband's cycle shop.

loans.name: Hector Fernando

texts.es:
Héctor, es un joven soltero que por iniciativa propia instalo en el mercado municipal una venta de ropa, la cual atiende desde 6:00a.m. a 5:00 p.m., esté horario depende mucho de cómo estén las ventas.
Héctor comprará camisas, pantalones blusas, en variedad de colores, estilos y tallas, con lo que surtirá su negocio en esta temporada de fin de año, espera tener mayores ventas, mejores ingresos, salir de su deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más amplio, seguir trabajando con créditos para sacarles el mejor provecho y tener más clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Hector is a young bachelor who, on his own initiative, set up a stall in the municipal market where he sells clothing.  He tends to this business from 6am until 5pm.  His schedule depends on how the sales are going.

With this loan, Hector will buy shirts, pants, and blouses in a variety of colors, styles and sizes.  This way he can stock up his business for the year-end selling season.  With this investment, he hopes to have more sales and income so that he can get out of debt.

Hector dreams of having a much bigger business and continuing to work with loans so that he can increase his profits and have more satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants and blouses

loans.name: Teu

texts.en:
Teu is a 28-year-old single mother of one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Teu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and paints and timbers for home improvements. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Teu hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and paints and timbers

loans.name: Sifolau

texts.en: Sifolau is a 35 year old single mother of two. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, a frying pan and a gas oven. In the future, Sifolau hopes to expand her business and pay for her children's school fees. She just joined SPBD in October of this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, a frying pan and a gas oven.

loans.name: Taegogo

texts.en: Taegogo is 29 years old and married with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been in this business for five years. Taegogo needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and other farming supplies. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Taegogo will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es: Honorato continúa dedicándose a la agricultura y a brindar servicio de transporte, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más, él continúa en el banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Honorato continues his farming operation where he grows and tends crops such as potatoes, corn, barley, oca and others. He is still an active member of the community bank affiliated with Association Arariwa, and he is a very cheerful and responsible person.
